channel.title: I just got a customs question
channel.description:
if i add customs to a client do i have to add to source too
i kno a noob question
......

item.description:
@Eonix wrote:

koopa king:

I believe that is all you have to do. If you have to do more, look at the model section of the forums. I am 99% sure they tell you what to do if you are making a new model with a recolor of a previous model in one of the stickies.

if i could i would rep you

item.source: I just got a customs question

item.title: I just got a customs question
item.dc:creator: @Eonix Eonix
item.description:
@Eonix wrote:

koopa king:

You have to put the ints for the item in for your client. Ints, if I am correct, are what make it wield a certain way and where they wield at, and also what color (since you can recolor models through ints). If you want your weapon to have any bonuses, like strength or attack bonuses, you have to put it in your source as well.

ok finnally an answer but 1 more question where do i save in source

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

You have to put the ints for the item in for your client. Ints, if I am correct, are what make it wield a certain way and where they wield at, and also what color (since you can recolor models through ints). If you want your weapon to have any bonuses, like strength or attack bonuses, you have to put it in your source as well.
